Yeah, I'm going to be little more than a +1, but think about all the games out there with similar mechanics and similar theme. For example, First Person Shooters -- they're a dime a dozen, yet there's enough subtlety between each that you can ask any gamer what his or her favorite is and they'll nail which one and why.

Personally, I hope KSP opens up the space exploration game market enough to attract studios with larger production values. I don't wish for Squad to go out of business (and I doubt they will) but think of a KSP-inspired title made by a huge team of artists and developers. Imagine "Space Engine" level graphics combined with KSP's lego-style rocket building. I'm excited to see what competition can bring to the table, and I'll have my credit card ready.
Uh, I mean, this has been on phones for a while now. And I think the devs are even on the forums here...

I've played both SimpleRockets (on my phone) and KSP for a while. I can tell you that the devs themselves say they owe a LOT to KSP (they even encouraged players of SR to check it out). Plus, it might encourage more competition and open up this market...
He stole my Idea to ripoff KSP!
Agreed. I think the game is fine, the creator even links KSP saying it was a big inspiration for him. I'm fine with it.

Saying SimpleRockets is a ripoff of KSP is like saying Terraria is a ripoff of Minecraft. They have the same theme and a few high-level gameplay similarities, but that's about it.

If you want to talk about ripoffs, take a look at how similar most of the FPS games from a given time period tend to look. Far more similarities there than a complex 3D space flight sandbox vs a highly simplified 2D mobile port.
I had the same idea, I just never actually worked on it.

This isn't a ripoff, compared to the usual 'inspirations' simple rockets is actually quite original. It takes the idea of building rockets, which btw is a quiet close ripoff of real space programs, and uses it for a game that's simpler and more marketed to mobile devices.
